abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column warns consumers with low credit scores about dangers of applying for so-called fee harvester cards, which offer very low credit limits but charge high upfront fees that gobble available credit, effectively driving up interest rate; offers suggestions for how to build credit without one of these cards.
lead_paragraph: The actions of a provider of fee harvester cards, recently ordered to pay a civil penalty, highlights the big fees faced by those with low credit scores.

headline.main: Subprime Borrowers Often Lured by High-Fee Credit Cards
headline.print_headline: Subprime Borrowers Often Lured by High-Fee Credit Cards

snippet: The actions of a provider of fee harvester cards, recently ordered to pay a civil penalty, highlights the big fees faced by those with low credit scores.
